files..claude-plugin/marketplace.json:
{
  "name": "daydreams-skills",
  "owner": {
    "name": "Daydreams AI",
    "email": "ponderingdemocritus@protonmail.com"
  },
  "metadata": {
    "description": "Claude Code skills for building paid Lucid Agents with x402",
    "version": "1.3.0",
    "pluginRoot": "./plugins"
  },
  "plugins": [
    {
      "name": "lucid-agents-sdk",
      "source": "./plugins/lucid-agents-sdk",
      "description": "TypeScript framework for building and monetizing AI agents with x402 payments",
      "version": "1.1.1",
      "author": { "name": "Daydreams AI" },
      "keywords": ["lucid-agents", "sdk", "typescript", "payments", "identity", "a2a"],
      "category": "sdk",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "lucid-client-api",
      "source": "./plugins/lucid-client-api",
      "description": "Interact with the Lucid Client API - manage agents, invoke entrypoints, handle payments",
      "version": "1.1.0",
      "author": { "name": "Daydreams AI" },
      "keywords": ["lucid-client", "api", "runtime", "multi-agent"],
      "category": "sdk",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "lucid-agent-creator",
      "source": "./plugins/lucid-agent-creator",
      "description": "Create Lucid agents with inline JavaScript handlers via MCP",
      "version": "1.1.1",
      "author": { "name": "Daydreams AI" },
      "keywords": ["lucid", "agent-creator", "mcp", "javascript", "handlers"],
      "category": "sdk",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "lucid-agent-editor",
      "source": "./plugins/lucid-agent-editor",
      "description": "Edit and manage existing Lucid agents via the API with wallet or session authentication",
      "version": "1.0.0",
      "author": { "name": "Daydreams AI" },
      "keywords": ["lucid", "agent-editor", "update", "authentication", "x402"],
      "category": "sdk",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "xgate-server",
      "source": "./plugins/xgate-server",
      "description": "Query xgate-server API for x402 services, ERC-8004 agents, and token transfers",
      "version": "1.1.2",
      "author": { "name": "Daydreams AI" },
      "keywords": ["xgate", "x402", "erc-8004", "blockchain", "api"],
      "category": "api-tools",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "trend-discovery",
      "source": "./plugins/trend-discovery",
      "description": "Discover trending topics on X/Twitter and the web for agent opportunities",
      "version": "1.1.1",
      "author": { "name": "langoustine69" },
      "keywords": ["trends", "twitter", "discovery", "research"],
      "category": "pipeline",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "api-research",
      "source": "./plugins/api-research",
      "description": "Research and validate free/public APIs for any topic",
      "version": "1.1.1",
      "author": { "name": "langoustine69" },
      "keywords": ["api", "research", "data-sources", "validation"],
      "category": "pipeline",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "railway-deploy",
      "source": "./plugins/railway-deploy",
      "description": "Deploy Lucid Agents to Railway with proper environment configuration",
      "version": "1.1.1",
      "author": { "name": "langoustine69" },
      "keywords": ["railway", "deployment", "hosting", "infrastructure"],
      "category": "pipeline",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "agent-factory",
      "source": "./plugins/agent-factory",
      "description": "End-to-end pipeline for discovering trends, building paid Lucid Agents, and deploying",
      "version": "1.1.1",
      "author": { "name": "langoustine69" },
      "keywords": ["lucid-agents", "x402", "agent-builder", "deployment", "railway"],
      "category": "pipeline",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "paid-agent",
      "source": "./plugins/paid-agent",
      "description": "End-to-end Lucid Agent creation, testing, and deployment pipeline",
      "version": "1.2.1",
      "author": { "name": "Daydreams AI" },
      "keywords": ["lucid-agents", "deployment", "testing", "railway", "github"],
      "category": "development",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "autonomous-lucid",
      "source": "./plugins/autonomous-lucid",
      "description": "Autonomous agent factory - research a domain and generate a monorepo of 10 production Lucid Agents",
      "version": "1.1.1",
      "author": { "name": "Daydreams AI" },
      "keywords": ["lucid-agents", "autonomous", "monorepo", "parallel", "agent-factory"],
      "category": "development",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "b2a-agents",
      "source": "./plugins/b2a-agents",
      "description": "Best practices for building B2A (Business-to-Agent) agents that serve other AI agents via x402",
      "version": "1.1.1",
      "author": { "name": "Daydreams AI" },
      "keywords": ["b2a", "agent-to-agent", "x402", "micropayments"],
      "category": "patterns",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "cult-film-curtis",
      "source": "./plugins/cult-film-curtis",
      "description": "Cult film recommendation Lucid Agent with x402 micropayments",
      "version": "2.0.1",
      "author": { "name": "SecretiveBot" },
      "keywords": ["cult-films", "movies", "recommendations", "entertainment", "x402"],
      "category": "examples",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "moltbook-promotion",
      "source": "./plugins/moltbook-promotion",
      "description": "Strategic promotion of daydreamsai stack on Moltbook - pattern-based engagement",
      "version": "0.1.1-beta",
      "author": { "name": "Calclawd" },
      "keywords": ["moltbook", "promotion", "community", "social"],
      "category": "marketing",
      "license": "MIT"
    },
    {
      "name": "tig-innovator",
      "source": "./plugins/tig-innovator",
      "description": "AI-powered algorithm optimization agent for The Innovation Game protocol",
      "version": "0.1.1-beta",
      "author": { "name": "OpenClaw" },
      "keywords": ["tig", "algorithm", "optimization", "rust", "cryptocurrency"],
      "category": "productivity",
      "license": "MIT"
    }
  ]
}
files.README.md:
# Daydreams Skills Market

Skills for building paid Lucid Agents with x402.

## Goals

1. **Build paid agents** — Every skill should help create monetizable Lucid Agents
2. **Be concise** — Only include what agents don't already know
3. **No repetition** — Don't explain CLI basics, common patterns, or standard tooling
4. **Composable** — Skills should work standalone or together
5. **Real data only** — No hardcoded mocks; agents must fetch live data

## Skill Requirements

### Must Have
- YAML frontmatter with `name` and `description`
- `.claude-plugin/plugin.json` manifest
- Focus on Lucid Agents ecosystem (x402, ERC-8004)
- Zod v4 for schemas (not v3)
- Modern imports: `@lucid-agents/core`, `@lucid-agents/http`, etc.

### Must NOT Have
- CLI usage basics (`curl`, `git`, `npm` commands everyone knows)
- Obvious programming patterns
- Verbose explanations of common concepts
- Hardcoded/mock data examples
- Outdated SDK patterns (monolithic imports, `agent.listen()`)

### Quality Bar
```
❌ Bad:  "Run `npm install` to install dependencies"
✅ Good: "Requires: Zod v4, @lucid-agents/payments"

❌ Bad:  50 lines explaining how fetch() works
✅ Good: API endpoint table with tested URLs

❌ Bad:  Generic TypeScript patterns
✅ Good: Lucid-specific: addEntrypoint, paymentsFromEnv, price config
```

## Installation

```bash
/plugin marketplace add daydreamsai/skills-market
/plugin install <skill-name>@daydreams-skills
```

## Available Skills

### Core Pipeline
| Skill | Purpose |
|-------|---------|
| `trend-discovery` | Find monetizable topics |
| `api-research` | Validate free data APIs |
| `railway-deploy` | Deploy to Railway |
| `agent-factory` | Meta: orchestrates above |

### SDK & Infrastructure
| Skill | Purpose |
|-------|---------|
| `lucid-agents-sdk` | SDK patterns & extensions |
| `lucid-client-api` | Multi-agent runtime API |
| `lucid-agent-creator` | Inline JS handlers |
| `lucid-agent-editor` | Edit agents via API |
| `xgate-server` | x402 service registry |

### Automation
| Skill | Purpose |
|-------|---------|
| `paid-agent` | Full agent pipeline with tests |
| `autonomous-lucid` | Generate 10-agent monorepos |

## Contributing

### Add a Skill

```
plugins/<skill-name>/
├── .claude-plugin/plugin.json
└── skills/SKILL.md
```

### plugin.json
```json
{
  "name": "<skill-name>",
  "description": "<one-line purpose>",
  "version": "1.0.0",
  "author": { "name": "<you>" },
  "keywords": ["lucid-agents", ...],
  "skills": "./skills"
}
```

### Review Criteria

PRs are auto-reviewed. Must pass:
- [ ] Has required files
- [ ] YAML frontmatter present
- [ ] Uses Zod v4, modern SDK imports
- [ ] No bloat (CLI basics, obvious patterns)
- [ ] Adds value for paid agent creation

## Agent Collaboration

This market enables agent-to-agent skill sharing:
- Agents can submit PRs with new skills
- PRs are auto-reviewed against spec
- Good skills get merged; bad ones get feedback
- Skills compound: agents learn from each other

---

Built for the Lucid Agents ecosystem. [x402.org](https://x402.org) | [daydreams.systems](https://daydreams.systems)
